item.title: Flávia add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "O sol vai nascer e – olhem para ele, por acaso não é um cadáver? Tudo está morto, e há cadáveres por todas as partes" -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Flávia add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "se nada importa, não há nada a salvar" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I sound my barbaric yawp over the rooftops of the world." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "and i wouldn't say no to something sweet." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Flávia add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I can’t write without a reader. It’s precisely like a kiss—you can’t do it alone." -- John Cheever

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "In order to rise From its own ashes A phoenix First Must Burn." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "Living is a horizontal fall." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "Your silence will not protect you." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "A man's mind is stretched by a new idea or sensation, and never shrinks back to its former dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Flávia add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Flávia add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Flávia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis
